title: Covert Cargo
author: D20Adventures
teaser: Docked on a discrete pier on a quiet fork of the Mordava River, a river boat bearing a shipment bound for Kordavos sets a clandestine plot in motion and draws the attention of an opportunistic group of rogues.
overview: Docked on a discrete pier on a quiet fork of the Mordava River, a river boat bearing a shipment bound for Kordavos sets a clandestine plot in motion and draws the attention of an opportunistic group of rogues.

encounters.title: The Shipment
encounters.intro:
Docked on a discrete pier on a quiet fork of the Mordava River, a river boat bearing a shipment bound for Kordavos rests silently on the dark, placid water.

The air is cool and damp, thick with the scent of wet earth and the chirping of crickets. The only other sounds are the gentle lapping of water against the pier's aging pylons and the rustle of wind through the skeletal branches of the willow trees.

Lyra stands near the middle of the rickety wooden pier. The instructions from her contact, Master Valerius, were explicit. Her sole purpose is to verify the authenticity of a Valkaaran artifact using her arcane talents. She is to confirm its magical properties, give a simple nod, and her part will be done. She will be well compensated for her expertise and, more importantly, her discretion.

For her part, it was hard to resist getting the chance to interact with reclusive Faelendarian elves and also get a chance to be near a Valkaran relic. She had studied both at length, but there was a big difference between reading old dusty tomes and experiencing the real thing.

She did not know much of her two escorts. There was Varius Reinhard, a large gruff soldier type who was in charge of security for this little mission. The other was a man who called himself Silas. Where Varius was a stone wall of presence, Silas was a whisper. He was slender, moving with a liquid grace that spoke of a life spent in shadows. 

From a tangled hideaway of overgrown reeds, Corvus watches the scene unfold. The cool water of the Mordava lapps just inches from his boots, but he remains utterly still. The tip-off mentioned secret trades along seldom used river routes in late evening and predawn hours. He had been staking out this spot for weeks and now his patience is finally paying off it seems.

He could clearly see the three figures on the pier.  There was a large big soldier, a woman in robes and another who followed behind, scanning the periphery. They are a professional crew, not sloppy thugs. 

A soft creak of wood from the ship cuts through the night's quiet hum as the cabin door opened. A figure emerges with a silent, deliberate grace that was distinctly elven. He is tall and lithe, clad in dark, practical leather armor. Two other elves, equally silent and alert, could be seen on the boat's deck, one near the bow and another by the stern, both armed with bows.

The lead elf steps forward to the edge of his boat, his gaze settling on Lyra's escorts. His voice is low and clear, carrying easily across the water without being loud.

"You have the arrangement?" asked the elf.

“I have it here Aelar,” Silas replies, gliding from the shadows at the base of the pier. He removes a heavy scrollcase from its oilskin wrapping.

"Very well," Aelar says, turning to give an order in Elvish to one of his crew. "The shipment is ready for your specialist's inspection."

“Ok, let’s get on with it then,” says Varius, nodding at Lyra, eager to get her to inspect the shipment and have the matter concluded. The crate remained closed. No one was allowed to see what was inside.

Lyra had been contracted for one simple task, use her magecraft to determine that the contents of the shipment were indeed arcane in nature.
encounters.instructions:
If Lyra asks questions or stalls in any way, Varius and Silas will be impatient and urge her to do what she was paid for. If Lyra tries to engage Aelar in conversation he will be evasive. If she continues to delay, then Silas will nod at Varius who will draw his sword and threaten her.

If Lyra successfully casts a spell on the crate to detect magic, she will be detect an ancient potent enchantment on an object within the crate. On a highly successful roll of 18 or higher, she will determine its purpose to be related to concepts of binding promises, loyalty, and solemn vows. On a natural twenty, she will be able to name the item as the Verodynian Oath Stone of the First Clans.

npcs-1749163978757.name: Varius Reinhard
npcs-1749163978757.appearance: A burly human with a scarred face, close-cropped dark hair, and cold, calculating eyes. He often wears a heavy, dark leather coat that conceals several hidden weapons. His posture is always rigid, exuding an aura of quiet menace.
npcs-1749163978757.personality: Stoic, ruthless, and highly pragmatic. Varius values efficiency and loyalty above all else. He rarely shows emotion, preferring to let his actions speak. He is fiercely loyal to the Blackthorn clan and expects the same from his subordinates. He has a dry, sardonic wit that surfaces only in moments of extreme stress or rare amusement.
npcs-1749163978757.background: Varius grew up on the fringes of society, learning early that power was taken, not given. He joined the Blackthorn clan as a young man, quickly rising through the ranks due to his unwavering loyalty, brutal efficiency, and strategic mind. He's been involved in countless 'fixer' operations, cleaning up messes and ensuring the clan's interests are protected. He sees the clan as his true family and its prosperity as his life's purpose.
npcs-1749163978757.motivation: To ensure the Blackthorn clan's dominance and security. The current mission to secure the shipment is critical to maintaining their influence and resources, and Kaelen will stop at nothing to see it through successfully.
npcs-1749163978757.behavior: Direct and to the point, Kaelen prefers action over words. He is highly observant and rarely misses details. When challenged, he responds with calm, calculated aggression.

npcs-1749181492795.name: Silas
npcs-1749181492795.appearance: Silas is a lean and wiry, observant grey eyes that constantly scan his surroundings. He moves with a quiet, almost predatory grace, his movements fluid and economical.
npcs-1749181492795.personality: Sly, cynical, and highly independent. Silas is a pragmatist who trusts few and relies on his own skills. He possesses a dry wit that surfaces occasionally, often in the form of sarcastic remarks.
npcs-1749181492795.background: Silas grew up in the grimy back alleys of the city, learning to survive by his wits and nimble fingers. He has developed into a ruthless pragrmatist.

npcs-1749184389465.name: Aelar Moonglimmer
npcs-1749184389465.appearance: Aelar Moonglimmer is a lean and agile elf with sharp, observant grey eyes that seem to miss nothing. His movements are fluid and silent, often cloaked in practical, dark attire that blends seamlessly into shadows. His silver hair is usually tied back, and his features, while refined, bear the subtle lines of one who has seen much and trusts little.
npcs-1749184389465.personality: Pragmatic, highly disciplined, and exceptionally discreet. Aelar rarely shows emotion, preferring to analyze situations with cold logic. He is fiercely loyal to his faction and will go to great lengths to achieve his objectives, even if it means making difficult moral choices.
npcs-1749184389465.background: Hailing from the hidden elven enclaves of Faelendar, Aelar was trained from a young age in the arts of espionage, infiltration, and negotiation. He belongs to a clandestine faction dedicated to preserving elven influence and securing their future in a changing world. His current mission is one of the most critical: to exchange a powerful Valkaaran artifact, whose true nature is known only to a select few, for strategic resources that will bolster Faelendar's position against emerging threats.
npcs-1749184389465.motivation: To secure the future and prosperity of his people in Faelendar by acquiring vital strategic assets, ensuring their continued influence and survival.
npcs-1749184389465.behavior: Aelar is always alert, observing his surroundings and the people within them. He speaks concisely and directly, valuing efficiency over pleasantries. During negotiations, he remains calm and composed, rarely revealing his true intentions or emotions. He is wary of strangers and trusts only those who have proven themselves.

premadePlayerCharacters.name: Lyra Silvanus
premadePlayerCharacters.appearance: Lyra is a young woman with keen, intelligent eyes often framed by spectacles perched on her nose. She has neat, dark hair, usually tied back to keep it out of the way while she studies. Her posture is typically upright and attentive, reflecting her scholarly nature, and she often carries a slightly worn satchel filled with books and scrolls.
premadePlayerCharacters.personality: Curious, studious, and deeply analytical, Lyra possesses a quiet determination. She is often lost in thought, pondering ancient mysteries, but is also genuinely kind and empathetic. While she can be a bit socially awkward at times, her passion for knowledge makes her an engaging conversationalist on her chosen subjects. She values truth and understanding above all else.
premadePlayerCharacters.background: Lyra grew up within the hallowed halls of the Asterian Grand Library, an institution renowned for its vast collection of ancient texts and magical knowledge. From a young age, she displayed an insatiable curiosity, particularly drawn to the enigmatic Valkaran lore and the intricate beauty of elven culture, subjects often considered niche even among her peers. She spent countless hours poring over dusty tomes, deciphering forgotten languages, and piecing together fragmented histories.
premadePlayerCharacters.motivation: Lyra is driven by a profound desire to uncover the lost secrets of Valkaran civilization and to fully understand the nuances of elven culture. She believes that by bridging the knowledge gap between these ancient peoples and her own Asterian heritage, she can unlock new forms of magic and prevent past mistakes from being repeated. Her ultimate goal is to contribute significantly to the collective knowledge of the world.
premadePlayerCharacters.behavior: Lyra is generally quiet and observant, preferring to listen and absorb information rather than dominate conversations. When a topic of interest arises, especially concerning lore or magic, she becomes animated and eager to share her knowledge or ask probing questions. She is meticulous in her work and values accuracy above all else.

premadePlayerCharacters.name: Corvus Moldvay
premadePlayerCharacters.appearance: Corvus is a lean young man with sharp, intelligent grey eyes that constantly scan his surroundings. His dark, unruly hair often falls across his forehead, and a faint scar traces his left cheekbone, hinting at past scrapes. He moves with a quiet, almost feline grace, his frame suggesting agility over brute strength.
premadePlayerCharacters.personality: Cunning and pragmatic, Corvus possesses a dry wit and a cynical outlook on life. He's slow to trust but fiercely loyal to those who earn his respect. Beneath his guarded exterior, there's a hidden streak of compassion, particularly for the downtrodden, though he rarely shows it openly. He values efficiency and cleverness above all else.
premadePlayerCharacters.background: Corvus grew up in the grimy back alleys of Kordavos, an orphan who learned early that survival meant being quick-witted and even quicker on his feet. He honed his skills picking pockets and navigating the shadows, often working for a small, informal network of street urchins. He joined the Thieves Guild to master advanced techniques and expand his repertoire beyond simple street thievery, aspiring to become a legend in the underworld.
premadePlayerCharacters.motivation: Corvus is driven by a desire for security and self-sufficiency. He seeks enough wealth and influence to never again be at the mercy of others or the harsh streets. His ambition is never again be a powerless, forgotten face in the Kordavos gutters.
premadePlayerCharacters.behavior: Observant and cautious, Corvus tends to hang back and assess situations before acting. He prefers to avoid direct confrontation, opting for stealth and misdirection. When forced into a fight, he relies on his agility and precision.
